title: `git annex sync` crash with submodule on windows
body:
@joeyh It looks as if it doesn't anticipate a submodule being present. 

Demo:

```
(base) C:\Users\mih>datalad create demo
[INFO] Creating a new annex repo at C:\Users\mih\demo
[INFO]   Detected a filesystem without fifo support.
[INFO]   Disabling ssh connection caching.
[INFO]   Detected a crippled filesystem.
[INFO]   Entering an adjusted branch where files are unlocked as this filesystem does not support locked files.
[INFO] Switched to branch 'adjusted/master(unlocked)'
create(ok): C:\Users\mih\demo (dataset)

(base) C:\Users\mih>cd demo

(base) C:\Users\mih\demo>datalad create -d . sub
[INFO] Creating a new annex repo at C:\Users\mih\demo\sub
[INFO]   Detected a filesystem without fifo support.
[INFO]   Disabling ssh connection caching.
[INFO]   Detected a crippled filesystem.
[INFO]   Entering an adjusted branch where files are unlocked as this filesystem does not support locked files.
[INFO] Switched to branch 'adjusted/master(unlocked)'
create(ok): sub (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  create (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)

(base) C:\Users\mih\demo>git status
On branch adjusted/master(unlocked)
nothing to commit, working tree clean

(base) C:\Users\mih\demo>git annex sync
commit
On branch adjusted/master(unlocked)
nothing to commit, working tree clean
ok
fatal: entry 'sub' object type (blob) doesn't match mode type (commit)
git-annex: user error (git ["--git-dir=.git","--work-tree=.","--literal-pathspecs","mktree","--batch","-z"] exited 128)

```
